meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of organisms that produce their own food using light energy.
meanings.sent1: The photoautotrophic plants in the garden thrive under the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the photoautotrophic process in green leaves.
meanings.sent3: The photoautotrophic flowers seemed to be waving at the sun happily.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a photoautotrophic organism absorbing sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The photoautotrophic nature of the trees was evident in their vibrant green color.

meanings.definition: Capable of synthesizing organic compounds from inorganic substances using light as a source of energy.
meanings.sent1: The photoautotrophic bacteria play a crucial role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: Certain algae species are known for their photoautotrophic abilities.
meanings.sent3: The photoautotrophic reaction in the lab created quite a colorful display.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a photoautotrophic process, turning ideas into reality.
meanings.sent5: The photoautotrophic mechanism of the plant fascinated the students during the science experiment.
